qas.question: When was the first known use of the word "computer"?
In which book, was the term "computer" first used?
Who was the author of the book, The Yong Mans Gleanings?
From the end of what century, did the word "computer" take its well known meaning of today?

context: The first known use of the word "computer" was in <a0_0>1613<a0_0/> in a book called <a1_0>The Yong Mans Gleanings<a1_0/> by English writer <a2_0>Richard Braithwait<a2_0/>: "I haue read the truest computer of Times, and the best Arithmetician that euer breathed, and he reduceth thy dayes into a short number." It referred to a person who carried out calculations, or computations. The word continued with the same meaning until the middle of the 20th century. From the end of the <a3_0>19th century<a3_0/> the word began to take on its more familiar meaning, a machine that carries out computations.
